item.title: RT Falcon Finance ğŸ¦…ğŸŸ : Wallet registration for claiming $FF is now open. To claim FF, make sure to register your wallet before 28 Sep 2025, 23:59...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Falcon Finance ğŸ¦…ğŸŸ 
Wallet registration for claiming $FF is now open.

To claim FF, make sure to register your wallet before 28 Sep 2025, 23:59 UTC. This step is mandatory. Wallets not registered by the deadline will be disqualified from claiming.

Hereâ€™s how it works:
â†’ Go to: https://app.falcon.finance/claims
â†’ Connect and register your wallet(s)

Scenarios & claim methods:

ğŸ‘‰ Single wallet: Just register it. Linking to X (Twitter) is optional. Tokens will be claimed directly to that wallet.

ğŸ‘‰ Multiple wallets, no X account connected: Register each wallet individually, and each wallet will claim its share separately.

ğŸ‘‰ Multiple wallets, connected to X: All wallets tied to the same X account count as one registration. You can choose to:
â†’ Claim on separate wallets: each linked wallet receives its share individually
â†’ Combine all tokens to one wallet: claims from all linked wallets are consolidated and sent to one main wallet of your choice

Please note that:

ğŸ“Œ You can change your claim method until the deadline, but once it passes the choice is final. Any additional wallets linked to the same X account before the deadline will follow the same claim method.

ğŸ“Œ Eligibility for claims (Miles, Yap2Fly top 200 winners, Kaito stakers) will be checked only on registered wallets.

ğŸ“Œ Claiming is NOT open yet, but you must register before the deadline or forfeit your FF tokens. Register early to avoid last-minute issues.

item.title: RT Alex Becker ğŸŠğŸ†ğŸ¥‡: New notes on my Pump streams A) For the foreseeable future, I will continue to invest all creator funds back into making ...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Alex Becker ğŸŠğŸ†ğŸ¥‡
New notes on my Pump streams

A) For the foreseeable future, I will continue to invest all creator funds back into making the streams fun and interesting. This means more game contests, giving it to chat/followers in creative ways and donation reactions etc, as I've already been doing. Every cent made so far has been spent on the streams.

My main interest is honestly dominating creator crypto content and growing the biggest following on Pump (or whatever platform adds streaming utility best). I want to use the fees to do that, versus pocketing them and bouncing like other streamers.

I don't see a point in trying to "take profits" from the stream until the concept is proven to work. I think once utility comes to these platforms, this has massive potential, and I want to be the first mover if that potential comes to fruition.

B) For the foreseeable FOREVER future, this will be my streaming coin. I strongly believe we'll see streaming coins become a long-term staple as platforms give them utility.

I'm pushing Pump as best I can to add utility for streams as soon as possible. As I've said, the current meta doesn't work because streamers are incentivized to constantly launch new streams, and viewers are incentivized to find new launches. Streamers are then incentivized to stop streaming as volume slows and their fee percentage is reduced, so viewers are double-incentivized to bounce.

This punishes people who are actually there to make content and viewers who are there to engage, while rewarding short-term stream launches and people with no real interest in viewing.

That said, if some other platform adds utility or long-term functions to stream coins, part of me streaming there would be them importing $strszn OR airdropping all the holders the new coin (a 1-to-1 switch, with no bonus coins or extra coins).

As I've stated, I'm not promising anything, and I will never manipulate the coin or do things to pump it. I am, however, clearly stating my goal: if I do stream, it's for long-term content and using the token fees to grow that content. I think this gives it a huge edge over any other place I can stream crypto content.

For example, Twitch would pay me like $300 to do a stream for 2k people. We can do a stream on Pump and make way more, and then reinvest it into making over-the-top contests and promotions.

item.description:
No no no Zonny not this time, you and @0xKevinKap are just Larping.

A great app creates its own distribution. It has nothing to do with GP chains vs. appchains.

It has everything to do with finding the right market effect and the growth lever that matters most.

You can say Hyperliquid, I can say http://pump.fun.

Both prove the same thing: distribution follows the app, not the chain.

Hyperliquid.

*â€œAs I referenced earlier today, in the late 1980s I worked about four kilometers from where we are convening nowâ€”on the Place de la Concorde.

At the time, I could hardly have imagined returning in my current role to speak of new technologies, including those that once were dismissed or resisted outright, yet are now revolutionizing global finance.

It seems only fitting, here just steps from Avenue Victor Hugo, to summon his words to our moment, â€˜on rÃ©siste Ã  lâ€™invasion des armÃ©es; on ne rÃ©siste pas Ã  lâ€™invasion des idÃ©esâ€™â€”an invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.

And today, ladies and gentlemen, we must admit that: cryptoâ€™s time has come.â€

item.title: Maybe so called classical crypto
item.description:
Maybe so called classical crypto


BaneğŸ’¤:â€‚I miss the old crypto.

Back then, it was full of addicts, weirdos, shitposters, and misfits who never quite fit into society. It was a cult of people who spoke up for bad taste, who reveled in nonsense and embraced absurdity. We found a place to hide inside this giant casino,
item.author: Jims Young

item.title: RT BaneğŸ’¤: I miss the old crypto. Back then, it was full of addicts, weirdos, shitposters, and misfits who never quite fit into society. It was a cu...
item.description:
RTâ€‚BaneğŸ’¤
I miss the old crypto.

Back then, it was full of addicts, weirdos, shitposters, and misfits who never quite fit into society. It was a cult of people who spoke up for bad taste, who reveled in nonsense and embraced absurdity. We found a place to hide inside this giant casino, and somehowâ€”even while losing moneyâ€”it felt like we were escaping the pain of real life for a while.
I was always the least cool kid in class, but I kind of loved being surrounded by bad kids and dumb narratives.

Now everything feels too polished, too righteous, too picture-perfect. Even though you know theyâ€™re still scammers, they dress like kings and talk like angels, and it leaves you nothing to fight back with.

Has the industry actually changed at all from four years ago? It doesnâ€™t seem like it. The same startup ideas, the same product designs, the same pump-and-dumps. The only difference is, they tell us the reason we didnâ€™t make it back then is because we werenâ€™t â€œchosenâ€â€”not from tradfi, not regulatory royalty like them. And maybe they did win, for now.

So what has crypto really brought to the world? If the answer is still just gamblingâ€¦ then I hope at least this casino can have more weird voices again. More outcasts, more chaos, more color. More CULTS.

I miss the old crypto.
item.author: Leo the Horseman (prediction arc)

item.description:
RTâ€‚Scam Sniffer | Web3 Anti-Scam
ğŸš¨ NPM Supply Chain Attack ğŸš¨

Popular dev qix fell victim to phishing. Malicious code injected into npm packages now hijacks crypto transactions at signing.

Attack method:
â€¢ Hooks wallet functions (request/send)
â€¢ Swaps recipient addresses in ETH/SOL transactions
â€¢ Replaces addresses in network responses

Affected: chalk, strip-ansi, color-convert & more

Stay safe:
âœ“ Verify recipient/amount on wallet screen
âœ“ Check if addresses change after pasting
âœ“ Review recent transactions
âœ“ Use hardware wallets for high-value ops

Details: https://jdstaerk.substack.com/p/we-just-found-malicious-code-in-the

å»ğŸ‘‚äº†ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œè®© AI æŠŠ @ryanfang95 çš„å¯¹è¯è®°å½•æ•´ç†å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š

â€œSo we believe that uh uh there were certain you know, first of all, you know, we are appalled by a situation like what I'm about to describe is potentially took place. Okay, uh, we believe that there were very large token holder that might have manipulated, you know, price to essentially kind of lock in profits.

And we do believe that in a world centralized exchange hold a lot of users funds, there is potential that certain exchange could be essentially attracting users token and actually send users token to other exchange to sell.

Again, we are still very much in exploration and discovery about this. We think there is certain likelihood the above mentioned might have had might have happened. Now, imagine if, let's say, a big exchange have a lot of users assets and send large chunks of user asset to other exchange where there might be better liquidity and solo token and things like that.

And at the same time, opening very large short position. Again, this could be, this is actually something the communities have notified us. There are some very smart community folks over the last six hour or so have been notifying the team that they believe something I just mentioned could be a possibility.

That would literally be some very big well manipulation systematically. We are going to look into it and we believe highly likely that caused a lot of damage over the last several days. But again, we do not have definitive proof yet on some of this information, but we believe something is or was happening over the last couple of days.â€
